channel.title: That Podcast with Beau and Dave
channel.copyright: 2022 That Podcast, Beau Simensen, and Dave Marshall
channel.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave talking about life as dads, programmers, and entrepreneurs.
channel.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
channel.description: Beau and Dave talking about life as dads, programmers, and entrepreneurs.

item.title: Episode 52: geocod.io with Michele and Mathias
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because building a product out of something you need is awesome
item.itunes:summary: Michele and Mathias from Geocodio join us to talk about their business.

item.title: Episode 51: The One with JMac
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Shift and BaseCode and stuff.
item.itunes:summary: Beau catches up with JMac about Shift and BaseCode.

item.title: Episode 50: The One Where We Talk to Shawn about Event Sourcery, CQRS, Event Sourcing and GDPR
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because it's about time we're leaving the wild west
item.itunes:summary: Because it's about time we're leaving the wild west

item.title: Episode 49: The One Where the Events Are the Sauce and Not the Meat
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because that's how EventSauce.io rolls.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss EventSauce (eventsauce.io) with Frank de Jonge.

item.title: Episode 48: The One Without All the CSS
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Except for that bit in shame.css
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss Tailwind CSS with Adam Wathan and Jonathan Reinink.

item.title: Episode 47: The One Where Silex Is Dead
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss the death of Silex with Kevin Boyd.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss the death of Silex with Kevin Boyd.

item.title: Episode 46: The One with the Last Jedi
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because we both love Star Wars.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss Star Wars: The Last Jedi.

item.title: Episode 45: The One Where We Talk about PSR-15 Again
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Some of this got solved
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss the current state of PHP FIG's HTTP Handler PSR.

item.title: Episode 44: The One Where We Manage Products
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Christophe Dujarric shares his experience with Product Management
item.itunes:summary: Christophe Dujarric joins Beau and Dave to talk about Product Management.

item.title: Episode 43: The one where we Marvel at Sketch
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave talk about design and prototyping workflows.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about design and prototyping workflows.

item.title: Episode 42: The one with the CPU vulnerabilities
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Meltdown and Spectre, oh my!
item.itunes:summary: Meltdown and Spectre, oh my!

item.title: Episode 41: SAD
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Health and Technology
item.itunes:summary: Health and Technology

item.title: Episode 40: Flex
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: The Future's So Bright, Dave Gotta Wear Blade's Shades
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave pick up after a two month break to talk about Symfony Flex and Alexa.

item.title: Episode 39: Public Relations
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: What's in a name?
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss skiing, skateboarding, Rebekah's book launch, Bullet Journaling, Rachel Nabor's Practical Cartooning for Technical Folk, Beau getting back into DJing, Dave dabbling in Bitcoin bot trading, Logan, and multiuser SaaS.

item.title: Episode 38: Bullet
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Sunshine PHP, Bullet Journaling, Mockery and Symfony Experiments.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss Sunshine PHP, Bullet Journaling, Mockery and Symfony Experiments.

item.title: Episode 37: Sold!
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Yes, Beau sounds like he is under water...
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss time bugs, companies being sold and AppleApp Store and Google Play store tax on "digital sales." They also talk about recent news in Symfony. This episode is the first edited by Beau. Be gentle.

item.title: Episode 36: Things
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: A potpourri of flavor!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave catch up on SensioLab's latest announcements, The Epic Guide to Bootstrapping your SaaS startup from scratch by yourself, Indie Hackers, and discuss convenient hosting for lots of small sites and apps.

item.title: Episode 35.5: Rogue One
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Here be Spoilers
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about Rogue One: A Star Wars Story, here be spoilers.

item.title: Episode 35: Stuff
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: The kind of show we do when we've not done one for a while...
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about stuff, including a voicemail from @jwage, generating ideas and discussion on twitter, new services we've seen or are using, the difference in number of attendees between European and US conferences, bucket list type things, what we're watching and planning on watching on TV.

item.title: Episode 34: Say What?
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Hey, bro.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about Beau's trip to the last True North PHP conference, trolls, writing and social media automation.

item.title: Episode 33: Lag
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: It was kinda like telling a UDP joke
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave somehow manage to form a coherent conversation despite laggy internet, about dynamic sharing images, Beau's application for Global Entry, overlays and Mailchimp automation, profilers like Blackfire and XHProf, and Beau having a new microphone.

item.title: Episode 32: Revival
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave are back
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave are back. Beau is back in the states. Dave has nothing interesting to report. We talk a little about what we've been up to and touch on getting started doing conference talks.

item.title: Episode 31: Middlewares!
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: All of this will get solved
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave recap Episode 20 from last year, discussing the PHP FIG PSR-7 middlewares proposal.

item.title: Episode 30: ...
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Stuff
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about Beau's recent trip to Cornwall, some family stuff like schools, Linux binaries on windows, parallelshell woes, cloud formation woes and FounderDating.com

item.title: Episode 29: npm install left-pad
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Who needs a standard library?
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about the recent left-pad kerfuffle in the javascript community.

item.title: Episode 28: Work, Work, Work
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Catch up on work efforts
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about some of their recent work efforts, Dave's first look at DynamoDB, other AWS services, migrating event streams, email integration with Context.io and the challenges of maintaining privacy with such systems.

item.title: Episode 27: A little less Grumpy
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: And a little shorter than it should be
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk to Chris Hartjes, commonly known as the Grumpy Programmer. They talk about how Chris grew his personal brand to support his collection of educational products, testing and testing tools, frameworks and components and OpenCFP.

item.title: Episode 26: Show me the Monii
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: I love That Podcast!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave start a series of episodes discussing Beau's new startup, Monii. We talk briefly about the features and scope of their first product, before diving in to the details of the front-end tech stack.

item.title: Episode 25: S02E01
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave catch up after a 5 month break. Beau has moved to the UK and is just about settled, Dave is much the same.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave catch up after a 5 month break. Beau has moved to the UK and is just about settled, Dave is much the same.

item.title: Episode 24: The last one... with a Friends themed title
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because Dave gets frustrated trying to think them up
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about work, automating deployments and ops, running an (R)ELK stack on AWS, Reactiflux getting kicked off Slack, Dave's work being awarded some government funding, Phil Sturgeon, Symfony autowiring and the 3.0 release, Zend Expressive, Adobe Creative Suite on case-sensitive filesystems and You Can't Teach a Kid to Ride a Bike at a Seminar.

item.title: Episode 23: The one where we're in Manchester
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because #PHPNW15
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave get together again, this time at PHPNW 2015. We talk about testing, Laravel's awesome container, chatops and security, react, before touching on docker and otto. Sorry to the listeners for the clicks, pops, whistles and background noise.

item.title: Episode 22: The one where we're in London again
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: because it is symfony live London time again!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave get together at Symfony Live London for a quick catch up and chat with Matthias Noback. Sorry about audio quality, there's a bit of mic handling and swapping going on as we're out on location!

item.title: Episode 21: The one with all the screen time
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because you gotta start 'em early
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave change gears and get to some family talk, discussing managing kids with devices and screen time, football/soccer, dance and swimming activities, Beau announces his new position with Monii.com, then the guys get back in their comfort zone and talk briefly about continuous integration services, docker and CQRS.

item.title: Episode 20: The one where we don't really prefer this over that
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: because who has time for reading every article
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave get in to PSR-7 and how we might be doing middlewares, framework or no framework, container PSR or not and a whole bunch of other stuff as usual.

item.title: Episode 19: The one where Taylor joins the conversation
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because we think he fits the mould
item.itunes:summary: Some time ago Dave had the idea to bring Taylor Otwell, creator of Laravel, on the show as he fit our general theme very well, he's a dad, a programmer, and is definitely an entrepreneur. Arrangements were made and since then, Beau has launched his first two Laravel apps and has started to use both Forge and Envoyer. Dave, too, has worked with Laravel a bit in the past, so it was a great time to Taylor on the show to talk life and shop.

item.title: Episode 18: The one where the basket dropped
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because if you want to make an omelette...
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave talk about podcast news, Star Wars, Mail and todo apps, putting all your eggs in one basket, AWS, PSR-7, splitting monolithic repositories for composer, boring technologies and recent projects and articles from the community.

item.title: Episode 17: The one where The Force Awakens
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because who doesn't like Star Wars...
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave get through the usual roundup, before getting in to the Star Wars universe. They talk the upcoming movie and the teaser trailer, Star Wars Rebels, The Clone Wars, how their kids are liking Star Wars and Star Wars canon. They then get back to the usual roundup. This episode was definitely not distributed by 20th Century Fox.

item.title: Episode 16: The one with HTTP/2
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because HTTP/1.1 isn't good enough anymore, apparently.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave catch up on their latest happenings and talk about HTTP/2, what makes it different and how we understand it could change the way we do things.

item.title: Episode 15: The first one where we follow-up on our goals for 2015
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because we've made good on them so far...
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss Beau's recent trip to PHP Benelux, That Podcast Merchandise, our progress with our newly formed habits for 2015, fitness, finances, writing, reading, Superbowl and family things.

item.title: Episode 14: The one with some accountability
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because you can only make lifestyle changes in January
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave welcome in the new year with discussions on their plans for 2015, including health and fitness, martial arts, managing finances, building reputation, the sculpin community, Beau and Rebekah's new #ossart project and various other things.

item.title: Episode 13: The one to cap 2014
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because it is the last episode of the year, yo!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave wrap up 2014 discussing a bunch of stuff. Dave was too excited about Christmas to write something more descriptive for this sentence. This one too.

item.title: Episode 12: The one where we find the time to discuss not finding the time
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because what we both really needed was to spend an hour or so recording a podcast
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave take time out of there busy schedules to discuss what they've been up to recently and get in to the how they do or don't find the time for side projects and open source, in and around work and family.

item.title: Episode 11: The one that Dave thought was kinda wishy washy
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because we didn't really get to our main topic
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave have officially crossed beyond the 10 episode milestone but were forced to keep things short because of various scheduling conflicts. Oddly enough, the actual topic of the episode was supposed to be along the lines of "making the time for projects and things" so that should make for a fun episode 12. That will be so meta. This time, though, they discuss what it looks like for podcast co-hosts to not always get along, colour blindness, recent and upcoming PHP conferences, PHP-FIG, recent happenings at work, and more fun encryption stuff. For those of you who like them to keep it short, this one is for you!

item.title: Episode 10: The one with the "best practices"
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: ... and the big 10 episode milestone!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave catch up on just about everything, before discussing the recent preview of the Official Symfony Best Practices document.

item.title: Episode 9: The one that wasn't invented here
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because NIH hasn't been talked about enough lately.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave give updates on their recent shenanigans, conferences, health, talk about the NIH and cloning discussions that have been had recently in the community, side projects, games, and two factor auth.

item.title: Episode 8: The one where PSR-0 is dead
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because controversial titles bring all the hits.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave are back together for another chat, covering conference talks, shellshock, Linux (on floppies), PHP Jeopardy and the marketing machine that is Jeremy Mikola, PHP-FIG, learning about AngularJS with CodeSchool.com and working with the TV on.

item.title: Episode 7.5: The Short One in London
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because we pretty much had to!
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave recap SymfonyLive London 2014 in their first live in person recording.

item.title: Episode 7: The one where we didn't even bother with a topic
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Because why would we?
item.itunes:summary: That's right, Beau and Dave are back! After what turned out to be a whole month since their last episode, the spend some time catching up on a bunch of things that have gone on in that time. Most importantly, Dave explains why dogs need passports. Who knew? Plus some other techy things. They keep it a little shorter than usual (only an hour and a half, yo!) on account of Dave not feeling so well. Also, Dave quits That Podcast because nobody has ever used his awesome voicemail app. Oh wait, no, that is a lie. He didn't quit. The other part was true about nobody leaving a voicemail, though. It makes them both sad.

item.title: Episode 6: The One Where We Didn't Even Get to Our Scheduled Topic
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Lots of updates and discussion
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave give updates on all sorts of things. So much so, they manage to not even get to the topic they actually expected to talk about. Fun times!

item.title: Episode 5: The One Where Everyone Is Going to London
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss a lot of recent goings on before a little talk about pair programming
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss having been selected to Symfony Live London and how they plan to bring their families with them so everyone can hang out in person for the first time. Beau discusses his other upcoming talks including Nomad PHP EU and php[world] and Dave talks a bit about his pair programming setup. Both agree that rewriting code from another project is a great way to really understand how the thing ticks.

item.title: Episode 4: The One where ORMs are Dead
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss Beau's recent exploration into the DDD world, leading him away from ORMs and into Events.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave discuss Beau's recent exploration into the DDD world, leading him away from ORMs and into Events.

item.title: Episode 3: The One with Paul talking about Action-Domain-Responder
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss ADR with their first guest, Paul M. Jones.
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave have their first guest, Paul M. Jones, who asked if he could join them to discuss their thoughts on his Action-Domain-Responder pattern after they mentioned it on the previous episode. In addition to discussing ADR, they discuss Paul's book, the process of writing a book, and similarities between writing books, blogging, and talks for conferences.

item.title: Episode 2: The One with the Lone Wolves
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss being lone wolf developers
item.itunes:summary: Beau and Dave recap their experience of launching That Podcast, Beau discusses his php[tek] experience, both discuss Paul M. Jones refinement on MVC (Action-Domain-Responder pattern) and then get down to discussing their experiences as lone wolf developers.

item.title: Episode 1: The First One
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Beau and Dave discuss their reasons for starting a podcast and touch a bit on TDD being dead (or not).

item.title: Episode 0: The Short Practice One
item.itunes:author: Beau Simensen & Dave Marshall
item.itunes:subtitle: Quick little recording demo.
item.itunes:summary: This was a quick technology demo we did in order to test out the recording process. It is a nice bit of legacy so we keep it around to remember where we started.
